text:
>  Also, particularly interested in how to evaluate earlier stage startups on their long-term viability
I’d ask about their plans for the future, like “where do you see the company in 5 years time? How will the industry develop?” etc.

elements.text: Also, particularly interested in how to evaluate earlier stage startups on their long-term viability
I’d ask about their plans for the future, like “where do you see the company in 5 years time? How will the industry develop?” etc.

text: are you familiar with the `Who` interviewing method <@U016AG4A2G2>? It’s developed by Geoff Smart and Randy Street, good book. You could take the score card and use that on the companies (instead of a person). So, you’d write down what kind of company you want to work for, what their cultural values are like, what the role entails, whether you get to manage a team or not, wheter you can work remote, travel etc.

elements.text: are you familiar with the
Who
interviewing method

? It’s developed by Geoff Smart and Randy Street, good book. You could take the score card and use that on the companies (instead of a person). So, you’d write down what kind of company you want to work for, what their cultural values are like, what the role entails, whether you get to manage a team or not, wheter you can work remote, travel etc.

text: make the interviewing process data-driven

elements.text: make the interviewing process data-driven

text: that’s what I would do, If i were ever to be on the other side of the table again.

elements.text: that’s what I would do, If i were ever to be on the other side of the table again.

text: <@UUVS5QTM3> take the time you need for a good story, I’d say. For most of what I/my team need, 30 minutes was usually fine; but I’ve had good success with 45 minutes as well when I thought the topic deserved longer. Never gone a whole hour—but again, this is anecdotal evidence and it all depends on what you want to achieve :slightly_smiling_face:

text:
Hey Everyone! I'm launching the 3C Podcast: Curating Content Creators next week (<https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-3c-podcast-curating-content-creators/id1549294633|Apple> / <https://open.spotify.com/show/7vdvpWnoUQx1g8pvT2d2kb?si=w4cYEqMeQ6etdywtCYhxbg|Spotify>). It's a platform for B2B Marketers to talk about their content strategy, focusing heavily on distribution.

A couple questions:

1. What are some companies in the B2B space that you think are crushing with their content?
2. Who are some content marketers in B2B that I should speak with? (it's ok if it's not the same people everyone else is speaking with)
Leaving any feedback in the thread would be money. Also, won't be mad for an early adopter follow or sub. Thanks everyone! :100:

elements.text: Hey Everyone! I'm launching the 3C Podcast: Curating Content Creators next week (
Apple
Spotify

). It's a platform for B2B Marketers to talk about their content strategy, focusing heavily on distribution.

A couple questions:
What are some companies in the B2B space that you think are crushing with their content?
Who are some content marketers in B2B that I should speak with? (it's ok if it's not the same people everyone else is speaking with)
Leaving any feedback in the thread would be money. Also, won't be mad for an early adopter follow or sub. Thanks everyone!

text: Drift, Webflow, Lessonly, and Elate are some faves that come to mind.

elements.text: Drift, Webflow, Lessonly, and Elate are some faves that come to mind.

’s list. Would also add Gong.

text:
I'm looking to update my <https://www.linkedin.com/in/jesscookcreative/|LinkedIn profile>. (The bio is in 3rd person :grimacing:, I've not filled out my current position with any achievements or accolades :woman-facepalming::skin-tone-2: ... it's time.)

Anyone other content marketers here have a profile they're particularly proud of that I could look to for inspiration? :sparkles:

text: Hello! Not all of our members are guys. In an effort to be more conscious of the language we use to address each other, why not try “Hey, folks,” or “Hey everyone” instead?

Are there any good B2B Content Marketing Courses or B2B Social Media Marketing Courses that you would recommend? I want to assign out some continued education courses to my team while I'm out on leave so I'm on the hunt!
